io.raffi.JSON

Class Lexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.raffi.JSON.Lexer

  • public class Lexer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the Lexer class and is initialized with either a JSON string, JSON file, or JSON input stream. The input data stream is there in order to load resources inside packages. It then converts the data into a string, if needed, and then starts tokenizing the data stream on the request of the nextToken method. The Lexer exists to make parsing way easier, by tokenizing characters into chunks and classifying them as a type.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Rafael Grigorian

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Lexer(java.io.File filepath)
      This constructor takes in a JSON data file and saves the data internally, saves the data length, and initialized the positional data members.
      protected Lexer(java.io.InputStream resource)
      This constructor takes in a JSON data input stream and saves the data internally, saves the data length, and initialized the positional data members.
      protected Lexer(java.lang.String data)
      This constructor takes in a JSON data string and saves the data internally, saves the data length, and initialized the positional data members.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected Token nextToken()
      This method returns the next token that is encountered in the data stream that we got passed in the constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lexer

        protected Lexer(java.lang.String data)
        This constructor takes in a JSON data string and saves the data internally, saves the data length, and initialized the positional data members.
        Parameters:
        String - data The JSON data string to tokenize

      • Lexer

        protected Lexer(java.io.File filepath)
        This constructor takes in a JSON data file and saves the data internally, saves the data length, and initialized the positional data members. If no file is found, then JSONException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        File - filepath The JSON data file to tokenize

      • Lexer

        protected Lexer(java.io.InputStream resource)
        This constructor takes in a JSON data input stream and saves the data internally, saves the data length, and initialized the positional data members. If the input stream is null, a JSONException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        InputStream - resource The JSON data input stream to tokenize

    • Method Detail

      • nextToken

        protected Token nextToken()
        This method returns the next token that is encountered in the data stream that we got passed in the constructor. If the data stream comes to the end, and a request to get a next token is occurred, then an End-Of-Token (EOT) is returned indefinitely.
        Returns:
        Token The token that is tokenized next in the data stream
